title: London Buses route 132
text:
London Buses route 132 is a <a href="Transport%20for%20London">Transport for London</a> contracted bus route in <a href="London">London</a>, England. Running between <a href="Bexleyheath">Bexleyheath</a> and <a href="North%20Greenwich%20bus%20station">North Greenwich bus station</a>, it is operated by <a href="London%20Central">London Central</a>.
History.
On 24 January 2009, the route was extended westwards via the <a href="Greenwich%20Peninsula">Greenwich Peninsula</a> to <a href="North%20Greenwich%20bus%20station">North Greenwich bus station</a>.
On 3 October 2009, East Thames Buses was sold to <a href="London%20General">London General</a>, which included a five-year contract to operate route 132. On 7 November 2009, the allocation was transferred to <a href="London%20Central">London Central</a>'s <a href="London%20Central%23Bexleyheath%20%28BX%29">Bexleyheath garage</a>.
Since October 2009, part of the route from Eltham to Bexleyheath has been covered at night by night bus route N21.
In 2012, the route was converted from single-decker to double-decker operation.
On 12 September 2015, the route gained a 24-hour service on Friday and Saturday nights.
In November 2020, Transport for London announced that the route would be operated by electric <a href="Double-decker%20bus">double-decker buses</a>.
